page.title: 14 JUNE FOR THE GALA!
page.content: The first Saturday in June is special for people of Dalmilling/Whitletts, for this is the day usually set aside for the {Gala.}The Community Committee spend a whole year making plans for this annual event.From as early as 1900, Whitletts,like so many mining communities,had their own gala.To try to give the community a feeling of working together,{this custom was {revived in 1980.}Traditionally,a{Gala {Queen}and her attendants are chosen from senior classes of local primary schools,while the page boys are selected from the local playgroup and from Westwood Nursery.The crowning ceremony starts off a week of fun and games for young and old alike.On the final Saturday a procession of people in fancy dress and of decorated floats parades round the area,adorned with flags,on its way to a sports field.
